channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WICKET-6913] Java 17 compatibility with cglib
item.description:
Wicket's use of cglib means that as of Java 16, you need to specify --illegal-access=permit. As of Java 17, this is no longer possible, which I've verified using a JDK 17 Early-Access Build.

See https://github.com/cglib/cglib/issues/191

See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66974846/java-lang-exceptionininitializererror-with-java-16-j-l-classformaterror-access

 


Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class net.sf.cglib.proxy.EnhancerCaused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class net.sf.cglib.proxy.Enhancer at org.apache.wicket.proxy.LazyInitProxyFactory.createProxy(LazyInitProxyFactory.java:182) at org.apache.wicket.spring.injection.annot.AnnotProxyFieldValueFactory.getFieldValue(AnnotProxyFieldValueFactory.java:166) at org.apache.wicket.injection.Injector.inject(Injector.java:111) at org.apache.wicket.spring.injection.annot.SpringComponentInjector.inject(SpringComponentInjector.java:124) at org.apache.wicket.spring.injection.annot.SpringComponentInjector.onInstantiation(SpringComponentInjector.java:130) at org.apache.wicket.application.ComponentInstantiationListenerCollection$1.notify(ComponentInstantiationListenerCollection.java:38) at org.apache.wicket.application.ComponentInstantiationListenerCollection$1.notify(ComponentInstantiationListenerCollection.java:34) at org.apache.wicket.util.listener.ListenerCollection.notify(ListenerCollection.java:80) at org.apache.wicket.application.ComponentInstantiationListenerCollection.onInstantiation(ComponentInstantiationListenerCollection.java:33) at org.apache.wicket.Component.<init>(Component.java:690) at org.apache.wicket.MarkupContainer.<init>(MarkupContainer.java:179) at org.apache.wicket.Page.<init>(Page.java:171) at org.apache.wicket.Page.<init>(Page.java:135) at org.apache.wicket.markup.html.WebPage.<init>(WebPage.java:74)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: AFAIK wicket-10 Java17 builds are green https://ci.apache.org/builders/wicket-10.x-java17 (except for some JavaDoc issues ...)

solomax I've updated the issue with a stack trace. I've not worked on the Wicket codebase directly, so can't comment too much but humbly lean towards the conclusion that there's a lack of test coverage around this, I don't think the build should be passing on Java 17.

Looking at the stacktrace I can definitely say that this is covered by unit tests. I will test it soon with a real app too!

As a workaround you could use Objenesis. We need to update the documentation as reported at WICKET-6911

I was able to reproduce the problem by starting wicket-examples with Java 17 b35.

It fails at start time because of the usage of wicket-jmx. Its org.apache.wicket.jmx.Initializer#createProxy() uses CGLib directly.

Using org.apache.wicket.proxy.objenesis.ObjenesisProxyFactory (from wicket-ioc) is not working because it also uses CGLib. It uses Objenesis only for instantiating the Class created by CGLib.

 

I see no solution for now but to wait for a new release of CGLib with improvements for Java 17.

Or as I suggested with WICKET-6836 to use ByteBuddy/Javassist instead of CGLib.

Commit 8e1a15b3c08a59cc21c285440d1bf4d3b1876419 in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=8e1a15b ]

WICKET-6913 Replace CGLib with ByteBuddy in LazyInitProxyFactory

TODO: Update the Objenesis related classes too and wicket-jmx

Commit 43f040e1ffc2ea03a458cb74aca186e2692e63e8 in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=43f040e ]

WICKET-6913 Convert Objenesis proxy generator to ByteBuddy

In branch WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy I've replaced CGLib with ByteBuddy, and now wicket-spring and wicket-jmx work fine now!

Guice 4.x uses shaded CGLib so the only way is to use 5.x (this is the case already in Wicket 10.x/master).

 

I don't see a non-breaking way to use ByteBuddy in Wicket 9.x. Here we will have to wait for an update in CGLib.
mgrigorov looks good to me, thank you!

There are still some bugs to resolve!

ByteBuddy rejects to create classes with package name "java.**". Currently WicketNamingStrategy modifies just the class name, so creating a proxy for java.util.ArrayList creates class "java.util.Wicket_Proxy_ArrayList". I've changed the naming strategy to modify the package name: "bytebuddy_generated_wicket_proxy.java.util.ArrayList".

 

The next problem I faced is in wicket-spring tests. There are two Spring beans which differ only in their generic type - ArrayList<String> and ArrayList<Integer>. For some reason this mix up at injection time. I think it is related to the ByteBuddy class cache. Debugging it.

Commit 44b9755a0cb8dbc909523c7e123cbf24c8381cf3 in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy-wicket-10.x from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=44b9755 ]

WICKET-6913 Replace CGLib with ByteBuddy in LazyInitProxyFactory

TODO: Update the Objenesis related classes too and wicket-jmx
(cherry picked from commit 8e1a15b3c08a59cc21c285440d1bf4d3b1876419)

Commit a480bcd353e0706a96a52d4199cf69e5fdf03d0c in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy-wicket-10.x from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=a480bcd ]

WICKET-6913 Convert Objenesis proxy generator to ByteBuddy

(cherry picked from commit 43f040e1ffc2ea03a458cb74aca186e2692e63e8)

Commit f16168bee0a56ef08ab2fc36f7a6ef669a7b8463 in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy-wicket-10.x from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=f16168b ]

WICKET-6913 Replace CGLib with ByteBuddy

Replace all occurrences of "cglib" with "byte-buddy".
Merge AbstractByteBuddyInterceptor and ByteBuddyInterceptor. I see no need of both. If an application needs special impl of #writeReplace() then it could extend ByteBuddyInterceptor and override it.
Improve Maven dependency management related to byte-buddy.

Using the new naming strategy leads to this test failure:

 

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Invisible super type class org.apache.wicket.proxy.PackagePrivateConcreteObject for class bytebuddy_generated_wicket_proxy.org.apache.wicket.proxy.PackagePrivateConcreteObject

 

We will have to use special branch for "java.**" ...

Commit b936ae7c6d4d168809516e8a12e832add30f46be in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy-wicket-10.x from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=b936ae7 ]

WICKET-6913 Set the ByteBuddy interceptor after creating an instance

This is needed because otherwise we may get a cached generated class with wrong interceptor (i.e. IProxyTargetLocator) for classes with generics

Commit 48a12e7251d644e092e509d1a10e573053711282 in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-replace-cglib-with-bytebuddy-wicket-10.x from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=48a12e7 ]

WICKET-6913 Fix typos in javadoc

martin-g opened a new pull request #476:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/476

CGLib is not well maintained and it does not work with JDK 17+.

This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

To unsubscribe, e-mail: commits-unsubscribe@wicket.apache.org

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

Replaced CGLib with ByteBuddy in master branch (Wicket 10.x).

For Wicket 9.x we cannot make such big change so we will have to wait for a new CGLib release.
mgrigorov when is Wicket 10 likely to be released?

There is no date set yet.

Wicket 10.x will use Jakarta EE APIs and several dependencies are still not available (e.g. Spring, Commons FileUpload, JBoss Weld (CDI), ...).

Feels like unless cglib step up to the plate, Wicket is going to block Java 17 upgrade for a long time. What's the breaking change by moving to ByteBuddy? The ASM bump? I don't think it's cricket for a framework to block an LTS version over the medium to long term. Could Wicket 10 become Wicket 11 and Wicket 10 is Java 17 support?

Seems to me we could fit this into Wicket 9.x - isn't the change mainly in LazyInitProxyFactory only?

Maybe as an optional feature via toggle-switch.

Or we could copy the new module from master to 9.x under a new name (wicket-oic-bytebuddy) and provide both. I don't think we can just change the implementation, as minor versions are supposed to be drop-in replacements, and IMHO that's not true if the dependencies change. However, you might also argue that this is just an implementation detail and the API doesn't change. I do agree with Robert, that we should try to support Java 17, the next LTS, for Wicket 9.x.

"IMHO that's not true if the dependencies change" I suppose a dependency upgrade, I.E. a hypothetical cglib Java 17 upgrade falls into this category too, so even that potential easy way out is off the cards without a little misdirection / config? Or would the intention be that the user application pom specifies the newer cglib version? I've been over there asking if they're planning anything soon, so hopefully get feedback soon.

A dependency upgrade normally is fine, but we guarantee API compatibility on upgrades within a major version. There's always a bit of a gray area when it comes to API changes in dependencies, as this is technically speaking not the Wicket API. However, swapping one dependency for an entirely different one can have serious consequences when upgrading. Therefore I opt to copy the updated module to Wicket 9.x under a new name. That way, we can stay entirely API compatible, and still offer support for Java 17.

I am afraid having two Maven/Java modules with same package structure won't work.

1) we have OSGi checker tests which validate that there are no two wicket-** modules with the same packages

2) since recently wicket-9.x and master have been JPMS-ed, so Java also complains when it sees modules with the same packages inside. Javadoc is my "favorite" - it complains when it builds the aggregate jar.

 

IMO what svenmeier  suggested is the easiest way for wicket-9.x. We could use a system property or env var to decide whether to use CGLib or ByteBuddy.

That's unfortunate, as these modules are obviously never meant to be used together. Instead of a system property, I would then go for class detection: if ByteBuddy is on the classpath, use that, if it's not, fallback to CGLib.

I am not sure whether this is safe enough.

ByteBuddy might come as a transitive dependency from another dependency. This should not affect Wicket internals without the user to have a chance to disable this. So, again we need a setting.
Shall I re-open this issue?

Re-opening for Wicket 9.x.

Unassigning myself for now because I am not sure when I will have time to do it. Please assign yourself if you start working on this.

Commit 395778f679b7d9be920e0f8ecec0dbc6f2c48b61 in wicket's branch refs/heads/master from Sven Meier
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=395778f ]

WICKET-6913 Interceptor must be public

otherwise JMX console will show no values

Commit c776f4d922b6ecd704f846748d488942d5b87ec2 in wicket's branch refs/heads/jmx-standardmbean-instead-proxy from Sven Meier
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=c776f4d ]

WICKET-6913 replace proxies with StandardMBean

I pushed a suggestion to branch jmx-standardmbean-instead-proxy that uses a StandardMBean without the need for any proxy generation.

IMHO this is less complicated and removes one dependency to cglib/bytebuddy - easing the backport of this issue to 9.x. Funnily it was me who introduced these proxies in wicket-jmx 7 years ago

Commit 7b3b938c065a224d3762179d42fc5cd5d3be7084 in wicket's branch refs/heads/jmx-standardmbean-instead-proxy from Sven Meier
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=7b3b938 ]

WICKET-6913 replace proxies with StandardMBean

svenmeier The approach with StandardMBean looks simpler indeed!

It would be good to create a new ticket for it!

I'm looking into backporting this to WIcket-9.x now.

But I think I've found a bug in the new byte-buddy based implementation, I'll have to check that first.

Commit d9275ce6f78ffe8ada321af480b66ddd8ca41f57 in wicket's branch refs/heads/master from Sven Meier
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=d9275ce ]

to trigger package access error

[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=7fb9fa5 ]

WICKET-6913 use pipe

to delegate, this works with package private and should be faster too

[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=eb42b15 ]

WICKET-6913 move package private

works fine with cglib already

Commit 8287aa9f762a08574fe4ff433524aa9f374687fc in wicket's branch refs/heads/WICKET-6913-wicket-9.x from Sven Meier
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=8287aa9 ]

WICKET-6913 bytebuddy for wicket-9.x

optional via system parameter wicket.ioc.proxyfactory

I pushed a solution for wicket-9.x to branch WICKET-6913-wicket-9.x

Note that most inner classes in LazyInitProxyFactory cannot be moved to the cglib subpackage due to backwards compatibility.
LGTM!

Commit 8939f130ffcb3d468aef060b7bcf000499510c4f in wicket's branch refs/heads/master from Sven Meier
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=8939f13 ]

WICKET-6911 refacture into factories

so it is easier to backport Byte Buddy (WICKET-6913);
remove code duplication with objenesis, improved detection, added hint
to exception and improvement to user-guide

Commit 5892a6009ac6933c36062ab1f2264ba11dbfcc1b in wicket's branch refs/heads/wicket-9.x from Sven Meier
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=5892a60 ]

WICKET-6913 backport bytebuddy and objenesis improvements

to wicket-9.x
I've changed the parameter to "wicket.io.useByteBuddy", since I didn't want to make this too plugin-ish. Wicket 10.x will just go with the 'better' library Byte Budy only.

robertandrewbain can you give this a try?

To cite the addition to the user-guide:

user-guide

For compatibility with Java 15+ runtimes, Wicket 10.x will use https://bytebuddy.net/#/[Byte Buddy] instead - this proxy generation was backported to Wicket 9.x and can optionally be used by specifying the `wicket.ioc.useByteBuddy` environment variable:

-Dwicket.ioc.useByteBuddy=true
svenmeier I sure can. I'll give this a go tomorrow. Thanks so much to everyone involved.

Commit e7aeb829ddac76c5626318d5f73a9fd4703d9d56 in wicket's branch refs/heads/master from Martin Tzvetanov Grigorov
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=wicket.git;h=e7aeb82 ]

WICKET-6913 Add generic type to IProxyFactory#createProxy()

Small syntatic sugar.
JdkProxyFactory now also implements IProxyFactory.

(cherry picked from commit e7aeb829ddac76c5626318d5f73a9fd4703d9d56)
svenmeier tested origin/wicket-9.x just now and it works.
May I mark it as 'closed'?
It's a yes from me.
